bugs.title: CVE-2022-24675 golang: encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-24675 golang: encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode

long_desc.thetext:
encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode

A large (more than 5 MB) PEM input can cause a stack overflow in Decode, leading the program to crash.

Thanks to Juho Nurminen of Mattermost who reported the error.

This is CVE-2022-24675 and https://go.dev/issue/51853.
Patch is here: https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/go/+/399816/

bugs.title: CVE-2022-28327 golang: crypto/elliptic: panic caused by oversized scalar

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-28327 golang: crypto/elliptic: panic caused by oversized scalar

long_desc.thetext:
crypto/elliptic: tolerate all oversized scalars in generic P-256

A crafted scalar input longer than 32 bytes can cause P256().ScalarMult or P256().ScalarBaseMult to panic. Indirect uses through crypto/ecdsa and crypto/tls are unaffected. amd64, arm64, ppc64le, and s390x are unaffected.

This was discovered thanks to a Project Wycheproof test vector.

This is CVE-2022-28327 and https://go.dev/issue/52075.
patch is here: https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/go/+/397135/

bugs.title: CVE-2022-24675 pack: golang: encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode [epel-8]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-24675 pack: golang: encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode [epel-8]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-24675 golang: encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode

long_desc.thetext:
encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode

A large (more than 5 MB) PEM input can cause a stack overflow in Decode, leading the program to crash.

Thanks to Juho Nurminen of Mattermost who reported the error.

This is CVE-2022-24675 and https://go.dev/issue/51853.
Patch is here: https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/go/+/399816/

bugs.title: CVE-2022-28327 pack: golang: crypto/elliptic: panic caused by oversized scalar [epel-8]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-28327 pack: golang: crypto/elliptic: panic caused by oversized scalar [epel-8]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-28327 golang: crypto/elliptic: panic caused by oversized scalar

long_desc.thetext:
crypto/elliptic: tolerate all oversized scalars in generic P-256

A crafted scalar input longer than 32 bytes can cause P256().ScalarMult or P256().ScalarBaseMult to panic. Indirect uses through crypto/ecdsa and crypto/tls are unaffected. amd64, arm64, ppc64le, and s390x are unaffected.

This was discovered thanks to a Project Wycheproof test vector.

This is CVE-2022-28327 and https://go.dev/issue/52075.
patch is here: https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/go/+/397135/

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

long_desc.thetext:
An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.

https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/L_3rmdT0BMU/m/yZDrXjIiBQAJ
https://pkg.go.dev/vuln/GO-2022-1144
https://go.dev/cl/455717
https://go.dev/issue/56350
https://go.dev/cl/455635

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41717 pack: golang: net/http: An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 pack: golang: net/http: An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41717 golang: net/http: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests

long_desc.thetext:
An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.

https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/L_3rmdT0BMU/m/yZDrXjIiBQAJ
https://pkg.go.dev/vuln/GO-2022-1144
https://go.dev/cl/455717
https://go.dev/issue/56350
https://go.dev/cl/455635

close_bugs=True
